description:
You've most likely encountered the High Priestess before, but in other forms - she can be seen in the archetypes of Persephone, Artemis, Isis and many more. When you encounter her, you will see her sitting on a cubic stone between the two pillars at Solomon’s Temple, Jachin, and Boaz. Jachin (right) is generally referred to as the Pillar of Establishment and Boaz (left) is the Pillar of Strength. The pillars also depict the duality of nature; masculine and feminine, good and evil, negative and positive.

The High Priestess's location between the two suggests that it is her responsibility to serve as a mediator between the depths of the reality. She is the third pillar - the path between. She believes that both pillars are equal and there is knowledge to be learned in both worlds. You will also notice that she wears the crown of Isis which can mean that she is a believer of magic. The high priestess wearing of the solar cross denotes that she is connected to the season of the earth and the earth itself. The crescent moon at her feet is seen also in many depictions of the Virgin Mary, and means that she has a complete grasp over her emotion and the pomegranates refer to the ambition of the priestess.

upright.overview:
The meaning of the High Priestess is related with inner knowledge. Her appearance in a reading can signify that it is time for you to listen to your intuition rather than prioritizing your intellect and conscious mind. When the High Priestess shows up it can depict an archetype known as the divine feminine - the mysterious female that understands and holds the answers to the deep unknowns; religion, self, nature. She represents someone that is intuitive, and beginning to open to her or his spirituality. Meditation, prayer and new spiritual work is indicated.

Her appearance in a reading can signify that it is time for you to listen to your intuition rather than prioritizing your intellect and conscious mind.

The card itself shows a night-time scene, meaning that the world in which she protects and guards is one that may at first seem frightening, but has the potential to lead us into the growth of the self. When she appears in a reading, she is calling to you to listen to her message, and follow her into your own depths. There is searching within yourself to be done for the answers that you seek. The answers to the questions you have are within, not without.
upright.career_meaning: When it comes to your career, the High Priestess may signal a period of education or higher learning. You may be returning to school for training. If you’re in a creative field, this card also can suggest new inspiration coming into your work. When making big choices about your future career or projects, the High Priestess also suggests relying on your gut instincts. There’s likely a lot of information there that will aid you. At times, this card can also signal the appearance of a mentor or guide that can help you progress further in your work.
upright.finances_meaning: Since the High Priestess is related to mystery and the unknown, be wary of discussing your finances with others. This card suggests keeping your financial situation hidden. Alternatively, if you’re being presented with the opportunity to put your finances into use, your intuition will know whether this is a good choice or not. Take some time to probe your feelings; if there are red-flags, something won’t feel right. Listen to those feelings.
upright.as_feelings:
Drawing The High Priestess invites you to delve into a deep, intuitive connection. This person is captivated by your mysterious aura and senses that there’s much more beneath the surface. Their feelings are instinctual rather than logical; they feel an undeniable pull towards you but remain cautious, wanting to understand the depths of your character before fully committing.
This card signals a time for self-reflection on your emotions. You may feel compelled to explore your inner self while wrestling with uncertainty about this relationship. Trusting your intuition will illuminate these complex feelings, guiding you as you uncover what truly resonates within and navigate this emotional landscape together.
upright.as_actions: The arrival of The High Priestess suggests that now is the time to turn inward and trust your intuition. You should focus on deepening your self-awareness and exploring your inner wisdom. This may involve setting aside quiet moments for meditation or journaling, allowing you to connect with your subconscious thoughts. Consider engaging in activities that foster creativity, such as painting or writing, which can help unlock hidden insights. Additionally, seek knowledge through reading spiritual texts or attending workshops that resonate with you. Embrace this period of reflection; it will guide you toward clarity and understanding in both personal and professional aspects of life.
upright.love: remain patient in love, calm exterior with inner passion, intimacy
upright.career: education, creative inspiration, guide, mentor, use instincts

reversed.overview: When it comes to the High Priestess reversed, it can mean that you are finding it difficult to listen to your intuition. It is time for you to meditate and try new approach, for at this moment, the rational approach will not work. Something has been telling you to follow your gut, but you may be ignoring the call. There is a lot of confusion around you, and your actions may feel contrary to what you know is right. You must never be afraid to ask questions of yourself that may illuminate a new path forward for you, one that is more authentic to your inner self and your individual values.
reversed.career_meaning: You may not have all the information when it comes to your work situation right now. Have people kept you in the dark? Because of this, you can feel alone and perhaps out of touch with your coworkers. It may also be that when it comes to making career decisions, you’re not listening to your intuition. Are you choosing to trust a business associate despite a gut feeling that they don’t have the best intentions for you? Are you staying in a job you despise despite your intuition telling you that this one isn’t meant for you? This card can also suggest a colleague who has hidden agendas; be wary of others. A warm demeanor may hide danger.
reversed.finances_meaning: Are you in the process of signing contracts, taking loans, getting a mortgage, or investing in something? There may be some details that you’re missing. The High Priestess reversed in a financial tarot meaning can suggest that you don’t quite have all the information you need to make a proper, educated decision. Make sure you have someone you can trust, and that can give you all the facts.
reversed.as_feelings:
The arrival of the reversed High Priestess suggests that this person is grappling with confusion and uncertainty. They may feel disconnected from their intuition regarding you, leading to mixed emotions or even mistrust. Their feelings might be clouded by secrets or misunderstandings, making it difficult for them to fully embrace what they truly want.
With regard to your own feelings, the reversed High Priestess indicates that you could be experiencing self-doubt or a lack of clarity within yourself. You might find it challenging to trust your instincts or understand your emotional landscape right now. This card encourages you to delve deeper into your inner world and confront any fears or uncertainties that are holding you back from achieving emotional fulfillment.
reversed.as_actions: The arrival of the High Priestess reversed suggests that you should take action by seeking clarity and confronting your inner truths. This card indicates a time to step away from distractions and tune into your intuition, which may have been clouded by external influences. Focus on self-reflection; journal your thoughts or meditate to uncover hidden feelings. It’s also essential to reassess any secrets or unspoken issues in your life, whether they are personal dilemmas or unresolved conflicts with others. By embracing vulnerability and honesty, you can create space for deeper understanding and growth, leading you toward more authentic connections and decisions.
reversed.love: ignoring intuition in romance, hiding true self with lover
reversed.career: feeling isolated, lacking project information, rejecting intuition
reversed.finances: lack of information, not knowing all the facts

abyss: The High Priestess is a still and quiet figure, guarding the door of both positive and negative forces. She is the sorceress who is aware of all mysteries and sees all that is hidden. She represents the subconscious and the doors within your mind that want to be opened. Within her palms she holds the yin and yang, representations of the positive male and negative female energies. The High Priestess is the one who stands at the veil of consciousness. Around her waist she holds three keys that unlock the soul, mind and heart. Her head is crowned with the crescent moon, for she is a daughter of the moon and draws her force from it. When the High Priestess appears in your reading, she brings forth a period of spiritual enlightenment. And whereas before, through the Magician we had the desire to create and bring things into being, the High Priestess has the power of unseen forces to manifest these desires. Nevertheless, do not forget that she is a figure who lives within the shadowy realm of the night. Therefore, be aware that her influences are sometimes hidden and can come through unexpected avenues.
